sen.j: 国清寺は、1504年（永正元年）頃、安東忠季によって創建された檜山安東氏の菩提寺であったが、安東氏（当時は秋田氏）が常陸国へ転封されたため、廃された。

sen.j: 東北大学附属図書館に所蔵されている「秋田盛季宛秋田実季書状」には、国清寺は忠季の法名であり忠季の父安東政季の法名である長亨寺と合わせ、秋田山龍穏院として建立されたことが記載されている。
sen.e: In the 'Akita morisue ate sojitsushojo', held by the Tohoku University Library, it is recorded that Kokuseiji was built as Akita-san Ryounin Temple, together with the Chokyoin which is the Buddhist name of Takasue's father Masasue Ando and Takasue (Buddhist name).

In the 'Akita morisue ate sojitsushojo', held by the Tohoku University Library, it is recorded that Kokuseiji was built as Akita-san Ryounin Temple, together with the Chokyoin which is the Buddhist name of Takasue's father Masasue Ando and Takasue (Buddhist name).

In 'the letter to Morisue AKITA from Sanesue AKITA', held by the Tohoku University Library, it is recorded that Kokusei-ji was the Buddhist name of Tadasue and built as Ryuonin Temple on Mt. Akita, together with the Chokyo-ji (長亨寺) which was the Buddhist name of Tadasue's father Masasue ANDO.
